SEARCH
Package cz.cvut.fel.omo.smarthome.model.abstractEntities

Class HouseHoldMember

java.lang.Object
cz.cvut.fel.omo.smarthome.model.abstractEntities.HouseHoldMember
All Implemented Interfaces:
MemberActions, Observer, Element
Direct Known Subclasses:
Dad, Daughter, Granny, Mom, Pet, Son
public abstract class HouseHoldMember extends Object implements MemberActions, Observer, Element
Abstract base class for all inhabitants of the house (people and pets).

This class handles event processing, movement around the house, and interactions with appliances and equipment. It implements the Observer and Visitor patterns.

    • update

      public void update(Event event)
      Updates the member based on a received event (Observer pattern).

      Prevents duplicate events and adds the event to the queue if the member is busy.

      Specified by:
      update in interface Observer
      Parameters:
      event - The received event.

    • updateSimulationTick

      public void updateSimulationTick()
      Logic executed in every simulation step (tick). Processes pending tasks from the todoList if the member is free.
      Specified by:
      updateSimulationTick in interface MemberActions

    • completeCurrentAction

      public void completeCurrentAction()
      Marks the current action as complete. Frees up the household member.

    • processEvent

      protected abstract void processEvent(Event event)
      Abstract method for processing a specific event type. Implementation depends on the concrete member type (e.g., Human vs. Pet).
      Parameters:
      event - The event to process.

    • moveToRoom

      public void moveToRoom(Room toRoom)
      Moves the member to a new room. Updates the room status by removing them from the old room and adding them to the new one.
      Parameters:
      toRoom - The destination room.

    • isAllowedToUse

      protected boolean isAllowedToUse(HouseholdItem item)
      Checks if the household member is allowed to use a given item, based on allowedItems.
      Parameters:
      item - The item (Appliance, Equipment) to check.
      Returns:
      true if the item is allowed, false otherwise.

    • getFreeSportsEquipment

      protected Optional<SportsEquipment> getFreeSportsEquipment(List<HouseholdItem> sportsEquipments)
      Finds a free piece of sports equipment that the member is allowed to use.
      Parameters:
      sportsEquipments - A list of sports equipment in the house.
      Returns:
      An Optional containing free equipment, if available.

    • getFreeAppliance

      protected Optional<Appliance> getFreeAppliance(List<HouseholdItem> appliances)
      Finds a free and available appliance that the member is allowed to use. Chooses randomly from available candidates.
      Parameters:
      appliances - A list of appliances in the house.
      Returns:
      An Optional containing a free appliance, if available.

    • useSportsEquipment

      protected boolean useSportsEquipment(SportsEquipment equipment)
      Uses the given sports equipment.
      Parameters:
      equipment - The equipment to use.
      Returns:
      true if the usage was successful, false otherwise.

    • useAppliance

      protected boolean useAppliance(Appliance appliance)
      Uses the given appliance. Uses an ApplianceProxy object to ensure consistent invocation of the use() method.
      Parameters:
      appliance - The appliance to use.
      Returns:
      true if the usage was successful, false otherwise.

    • generateEvent

      public Optional<Event> generateEvent()
      Generates a random event/action for the household member. This action could be sporting activity or appliance usage.
      Specified by:
      generateEvent in interface MemberActions
      Returns:
      An Optional containing a newly generated event, or empty if no action was triggered.

    • trySport

      protected boolean trySport()
      Attempts to start a sports activity if suitable equipment is available.
      Returns:
      true if an activity was successfully initiated, false otherwise.

    • tryAppliance

      protected abstract boolean tryAppliance()
      Abstract method to attempt using an appliance. Implementation is specific to concrete subclasses (e.g., defining which appliance to choose).
      Returns:
      true if appliance usage was successfully initiated, false otherwise.
